content.question: In the spring, blossoms on cherry trees can be damaged when temperatures fall below <math alttext="negative 2 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. When the forecast calls for air temperatures to be below <math alttext="negative 5 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for a few hours one night, a farmer sprays his blossoming cherry trees with water, claiming that the blossoms will be protected by the water as it freezes. Which of the following is a correct scientific justification for spraying water on the blossoms to protect them from temperatures below <math alttext="negative 2 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: Water on the blossoms will not freeze unless the air temperature falls significantly below <math alttext="negative 5 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Water is a good thermal conductor that transfers heat from the cold air to the blossoms, keeping the blossoms from going below <math alttext="negative 2 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The freezing of water is an endothermic process; thus, water that freezes on the blossoms absorbs heat from the atmosphere, which in turn keeps the blossoms above <math alttext="0 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The freezing of water is an exothermic process; thus, water that freezes on the blossoms releases heat to keep the blossoms at or above <math alttext="negative 2 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The freezing of water is an exothermic process; thus, water that freezes on the blossoms releases heat to keep the blossoms at or above <math alttext="negative 2 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.
